definition: guqin 古琴[gu3 qin2] (a type of zither)/musical instrument in general
variant of 琴[qin2], guqin or zither

sentences.english: That class increased her accomplishments as a pianist.
sentences.chinese: 那个培训班增长了她作为钢琴师的技艺。

sentences.english: Yes, China has some good luthiers making handmade concert quality guitars.
sentences.chinese: 是的，中国现在有很多好琴师在制作手工演奏会琴。

sentences.english: ''The Legend of 1900'' is at least gorgeous to look at.
sentences.chinese: 当然《海上钢琴师》至少乍看还是炫目的。

sentences.english: The pianist's execution of the concerto was marvellous.
sentences.chinese: 那钢琴师弹的协奏曲神乎其技。

sentences.english: Please do not shoot the pianist. He is doing his best.
sentences.chinese: 请别开枪打死那个钢琴师，他已经尽力了。

sentences.english: The pianist pounded out the tune with great effort.
sentences.chinese: 钢琴师用了很大气力才弹奏出这个调子。

sentences.english: I got the pianist from the genie".
sentences.chinese: 我从妖精那里得到小钢琴师的”。

sentences.english: Besides being a professional pianist, he is also a keen amateur singer.
sentences.chinese: 他不仅是名专业琴师，还是个热情的业余歌手。

sentences.english: Each luthier claiming that his method works very well.
sentences.chinese: 每个制琴师都说自己的方法很好。

sentences.english: Have you heard this Italian French luthier?
sentences.chinese: 你听说这个在法国的意大利人琴师吗？

sentences.english: The piano concerto was well rendered.
The luthiers usually do not sign these guitar labels.
sentences.chinese: 琴师也不会在琴上面签名。

sentences.english: The past two decades have seen a renaissance of string-instrument-making (violins, violas and cellos) by luthiers across the world.
sentences.chinese: 对制琴师来说，近二十年是全球弦乐制作的复兴时期。

sentences.english: He was perhaps the greatest organist and harpsichordist of his time.
sentences.chinese: 他可说是当代最伟大的风琴师和大键琴师。

sentences.english: The pianist played the happy pair out with the wedding March.
sentences.chinese: 钢琴师弹奏结婚进行曲送走这幸福的一对。

definition: huqin/family of Chinese two-stringed fiddles, with snakeskin covered wooden soundbox and bamboo bow with horsehair bowstring
jinghu, a smaller, higher-pitched erhu 二胡 (two-stringed fiddle) used to accompany Chinese opera/also called 京二胡
guzheng or long zither/long zither with 13 to 16 strings, developed from guqin 古琴 during Tang and Song times/Japanese koto
xiao, a Chinese musical instrument of ancient times, similar to panpipes

to play the xiao 簫|箫[xiao1] (mouth organ)/to beg while playing pipes; cf politician Wu Zixu 伍子胥[Wu3 Zi3 xu1], c. 520 BC destitute refugee in Wu town, 吳市吹簫|吴市吹箫[Wu2 shi4 chui1 xiao1]/to busk/virtuoso piper wins a beauty, cf 玉人吹簫|玉人吹箫[yu4 ren2 chui1 xiao1]/(slang) fellatio/blowjob
pipa, Chinese lute, with 4 strings, a large pear-shaped body and a fretted fingerboard
guqin or qin, a long zither with seven strings, plucked with the fingers
